title: HVAC System Best Practices for Energy Efficiency
overview: Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning systems typically account for 40-60% of building energy consumption.

practices: Use setback temperatures during unoccupied hours
Optimize start/stop times based on building thermal mass
Schedule ventilation based on actual occupancy
Upgrade to high-efficiency HVAC equipment (SEER 16+ for cooling, AFUE 90+ for heating)
Replace old chillers and boilers with modern efficient models
Install variable frequency drives (VFDs) on pumps and fans
Install programmable thermostats and zone controls
Optimize setpoints based on outdoor conditions

recommendations: Schedule HVAC shutdown during school breaks
Use night setback for unoccupied periods
Implement zone controls for different building areas
Differentiate HVAC schedules for classrooms vs. labs vs. offices
Implement demand-controlled ventilation in lecture halls
Use energy recovery in high-occupancy areas
